trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the Controllers folder, expand Add, then click New Scaffolded Item.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the Controllers folder, expand Add, then click New Scaffolded Item.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Add Scaffold dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Add Scaffold dialog.

trans-unit.source: Expand Azure Mobile Services, click Azure Mobile Services Custom Controller, click Add, supply a Controller name of CompleteAllController, and click Add again.
trans-unit.target: Expand Azure Mobile Services, click Azure Mobile Services Custom Controller, click Add, supply a Controller name of CompleteAllController, and click Add again.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new empty controller class named CompleteAllController.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new empty controller class named CompleteAllController.

trans-unit.source: If your dialog doesn't have Mobile Services-specific scaffolds, instead create a new Web API Controller - Empty.
trans-unit.target: If your dialog doesn't have Mobile Services-specific scaffolds, instead create a new Web API Controller - Empty.

trans-unit.source: In this new controller class, add a public Services property, which returns the ApiServices type.
trans-unit.target: In this new controller class, add a public Services property, which returns the ApiServices type.

trans-unit.source: This property is used to access server-specific settings from inside your controller.
trans-unit.target: This property is used to access server-specific settings from inside your controller.

trans-unit.source: Replace todolistService with the namespace of your mobile service project, which should be the mobile service name appended with Service.
trans-unit.target: Replace todolistService with the namespace of your mobile service project, which should be the mobile service name appended with Service.

trans-unit.source: In CompleteAllController.cs, add the following class to wrap the response sent to the client.
trans-unit.target: In CompleteAllController.cs, add the following class to wrap the response sent to the client.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the new controller.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the new controller.

trans-unit.source: Replace todolistContext with the name of the DbContext for your data model, which should be the mobile service name appended with Context.
trans-unit.target: Replace todolistContext with the name of the DbContext for your data model, which should be the mobile service name appended with Context.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, replace the schema name in the UPDATE statement with the name of your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, replace the schema name in the UPDATE statement with the name of your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This code uses the Database Class to access the TodoItems table directly to set the completed flag on all items.
trans-unit.target: This code uses the Database Class to access the TodoItems table directly to set the completed flag on all items.

trans-unit.source: This method supports a POST request, and the number of changed rows is returned to the client as an integer value.
trans-unit.target: This method supports a POST request, and the number of changed rows is returned to the client as an integer value.

trans-unit.source: With default permissions, anyone with the app key may call the custom API.
trans-unit.target: With default permissions, anyone with the app key may call the custom API.

trans-unit.source: However, the application key is not considered a secure credential because it may not be distributed or stored securely.
trans-unit.target: However, the application key is not considered a secure credential because it may not be distributed or stored securely.

trans-unit.source: Consider restricting access to only authenticated users for additional security.
trans-unit.target: Consider restricting access to only authenticated users for additional security.
